column4: what's win32codecs called? i can't find it in the package manager
it won't be there-- it is part of mediabuntu -- and the pages that ubottu linked you to will tell you how to install it
also see this guide How to Install win32 codec - Ubuntu Forums <http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=60754>
thanks, nice tip. i found something i thought was it, but it wasn't. i needed ubuntu-restricted-extras
here is another guide to installing w32 How to Install win32 codec - Ubuntu Forums <http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=60754>
thanks.. my current trouble is that apt-get instlal w32codecs won't work, says it's referenced by another package but no installation candidate is avail
isn't that second link the same as the first?
or just download the .deb from mediabuntu Medibuntu -- Details of release intrepid <http://packages.medibuntu.org/intrepid/index.html>
look at the bottom of that page
did you get my last link to this Medibuntu -- Details of package w32codecs in hardy <http://packages.medibuntu.org/hardy/w32codecs.html>
yes. so i can't get it straight from ubuntu?
I think you have to add mediabuntu to the repos like in the guide
or you can find it here Medibuntu -- Details of package w32codecs in intrepid <http://packages.medibuntu.org/intrepid/w32codecs.html>
I think once you add mediabuntu (like in the guide that ubottu gave) it will then show up in apt and in synaptic
